document_title: Executive Arrangements and Access to Information Regulations 2012

duties.duty_description: Hold meetings of decision-making bodies in public, subject to certain exceptions.
Exclude the public from meetings when confidential or exempt information is discussed.
Follow specific procedures before holding private meetings, including providing notice and reasons.
Give notice of the time and place of public meetings and make agendas available for inspection.
Make agendas and reports for public meetings available for public inspection.
Define and handle key decisions, including their significance and impact.
Publicise key decisions before they are made, including details and documents for inspection.
Follow general exception procedures when it is impracticable to publicise key decisions in advance.
Obtain agreement for urgent key decisions that cannot be deferred.
Record executive decisions made at meetings, including reasons and alternative options considered.
